channel.title: Mashable
channel.description: Mashable is a leading source for news, information & resources for the Connected Generation. Mashable reports on the importance of digital innovation and how it empowers and inspires people around the world. Mashable's 25 million monthly unique visitors and 10 million social media followers have become one of the most engaged online news communities. Founded in 2005, Mashable is headquartered in New York City with an office in San Francisco.
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader, subject to copyright and fair use.

item.title: FEMA App Adds Crowdsourcing for Disaster Relief
item.dc:creator: Dhiya Kuriakose
item.description:
Certain apps — like ones that help you wake up or beat writers' block — make your everyday life easier. Others help out in times of disaster

The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) released an update to its Android app this morning (the iOS version is waiting for Apple's authorization). While the app was previously only a destination to receive information such as shelter locations, it's now more of a two-way street

See also: Unlikely Tech Alliance Aids Recovery After Sandy

The app's major new feature is called "Disaster Reporter," which allows users to submit disaster-related images to be publicly hosted on the FEMA website. You can add short text descriptions to photos, which then go through a basic approval process to ensure images are relevant and do not disclose any user’s personal information. The images are then posted on a map for public viewing Read more...

More about Apps, Fema, Disaster Relief, Apps Software, and Us World

item.title: Grumpy Cat Little Mermaid Never Wants to Be Part of Your World
item.dc:creator: Annie Colbert
item.description:
"Look at this stuff, isn't it crap?"

If Disney had the gall to cast Grumpy Cat for the role of Ariel in The Little Mermaid, she would want no part in your silly world filled with stupid whatzits and terrible thingamabobs.

See also: 10 Disney Princesses Who Can Twerk Better Than You

Digital artist Eric Proctor gave the Internet's grouchiest cat a chance at princess stardom in "Part of Your No," above. This fish-tailed feline would have no troubles friending Ursula and, sadly, Flounder would probably end up fried and nibbled

BONUS: 10 Terrific Grumpy Cat Tributes on Etsy

Image: Used with permission, Eric Proctor Read more...

More about Art, Disney, Watercooler, Pics, and Grumpy Cat

item.title: 1 Out of 4 People Friend-Request Before the First Date
item.dc:creator: Dani Fankhauser
item.description:
When you’re on that first-ever first date, you have all kinds of questions: Should I hold her hand? Is a kiss goodnight too much to ask? How will I know if he likes me back?

On second dates and third dates, you begin to figure things out. That is, until digital communication complicates it even further. Suddenly you're not just waiting on a call, you’re also half-expecting a Facebook message or a Snapchat. And oh, good grief, what if you sent that naughty photo to the wrong person?

SEE ALSO: This Is Modern Dating (and You Should Be Worried) [COMIC]

Along with the help of Survata, Mashable surveyed 3,000 participants on what they found acceptable and polite in regard to dating in the digital age Read more...

More about Social Media, Features, Relationships, Lifestyle, and Work Play

item.title: How Can Twitter Make It Easier to Report Hate Speech?
item.dc:creator: The Daily Dot
item.description:
Death threats, rape threats and misogynist hate mail. If you're a woman who likes to express her opinion on the Internet, these might seem like inevitable responses. Just ask Anita Sarkeesian.

But this week may have been the final straw when it comes to Twitter's sexist hate mail problem. After feminist campaigner Caroline Criado-Perez received 50 rape threats in an hour, people began to sit up and take notice: The threats were plain to see, and Twitter didn't seem to be doing anything about it.

So, what did Criado-Perez do to inspire this level of vitriol? Not even anything particularly controversial: She'd led a campaign for a woman to be put on British banknotes. Read more...

More about Report, Twitter, Cyberbullying, Trolls, and Abuse

item.title: Viral Video Recap: Must-Watch Memes of the Week
item.dc:creator: Sean Fitz-Gerald
item.description:
Even though the summer heat waves are snapping, we're giving you one more reason to stay in the pool.

This week's edition of our viral video recap also includes a musical cat, the season finale of Convos With My Two-Year-Old, a fun fact about owls and a water-logged corgi.

See also: Viral Video Recap: Funniest Memes of the Week

Check out the memes above, and let us know your favorite is in the comments below.

Image: YouTube, ConvosWith2YrOld Read more...

item.title: Weekend Entertainment Rewind: Lady Gaga, Hillary Clinton, 'Star Wars'
item.dc:creator: Brian Anthony Hernandez
item.description:
Here's a quick recap of what you may have missed in the world of entertainment this weekend.

1. Lady Gaga Releases Art for "Applause" Single

Lady Gaga's anticipated musical comeback gained steam Sunday as the 27-year-old pop star made several announcements on social media, including unveiling the artwork for her upcoming single "Applause."

Artwork for new single 'Applause' in HQpic.twitter.com/er0GPxOI17

— Lady Gaga (@ladygaga) July 29, 2013

Gaga will perform the single, which is available for purchase on iTunes starting Aug. 19, for the first time during MTV's Video Music Awards on Aug. 25. On Facebook, Gaga announced that pre-orders for her ARTPOP album and its companion app will launch on Aug. 19 instead of Sept. 1 as originally planned. The album and app arrive on Nov. 11 Read more...

More about Entertainment, Tv, Music Videos, Lady Gaga, and Star Wars

item.title: The 15 Fastest-Growing Internet Stocks
item.dc:creator: Zoe Fox
item.description:
Netflix leads public Internet companies with the fastest-growing stock prices in the last year.

One year ago, on July 27, 2012, the stock closed at $58.92 per share. On Friday, it closed at $246.31, increasing 318% over the previous year. So if someone invested $100 in Netflix one year ago today, that would now be worth $418

See also: 10 Biggest Internet IPOs of the Last 10 Years [INFOGRAPHIC]

The entertainment streaming and delivery service's growth rate is proceeded by TripAdvisor, LinkedIn and Yahoo, which top this list.

Statista created chart below, which shows the change in stock prices over the past year Read more...

More about Netflix, Business, Stocks, Mobile, and Chart Of The Day

item.title: Hipsters and Hashtags and Falcons, Oh My!
item.dc:creator: Gabe Bergado
item.description:
Clown shirts, lamp shades and bikes without brake pads — all of the items required to enter hipster central

In the latest video from Derick Watts and The Sunday Blues, the YouTube comedy duo from South Africa highlights two of the biggest vices of our generation: hipsters and hashtags.

See also: Unpretentiousil Is the 'Cure' for Hipster

There's nothing wrong with wearing ironic clothing and using hashtags to increase visibility on our Instagram photos. But the video above pokes fun at certain outlandish hipsters. After watching, let us know your take in the comments.

BONUS: 12 Most Cliché Photos on Instagram Read more...

More about Video, Youtube, Watercooler, and Videos

item.title: New Wireless Upgrade Plans Could Boost iPhone Sales
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.description:
U.S. wireless carriers are making it easier for customers to upgrade phones more often. That's welcome news for consumers and could also provide a much-needed lift for Apple Inc. (AAPL) and Samsung Electronics Co.

Verizon Wireless is following AT&T Inc. (T) and T-Mobile US Inc. (TMUS), which earlier this month gave users an option to replace devices as often as every six months, rather than two years — the typical contract period for U.S. cellphones. Smartphone makers could use the help as they grapple with falling prices and a maturing market.

The success of the carriers' upgrade-friendly strategy, which lets consumers pay for a phone in monthly installments instead of an upfront fee, depends on the bulk of their customers reacting like Mona Khanna, a physician in Chicago. Read more...

More about Mobile Phones, Verizon, Upgrades, Iphone, and Apple

item.title: Apple Removes Technologies Chief From Top Executive Team
item.dc:creator: Seth Fiegerman
item.description:
Welcome to Apple's incredible shrinking executive team.

Bob Mansfield, Apple's SVP of technologies, has been removed from the company's top executive team, Apple confirmed on Sunday

See also: 22 Best Mac Apps of 2012

“Bob is no longer going to be on Apple’s executive team, but will remain at Apple working on special projects reporting to [CEO] Tim [Cook],” an Apple rep told AllThingsD in a statement. Apple did not immediately respond to our request for comment

Mansfield led Apple's hardware engineering team for years before announcing his plan to retire in mid-2012. He later agreed to stay on at the company for another two years in part, reportedly, because Apple pushed out its iOS chief Scott Forstall, who was said to have poor relations with some other members of the leadership team Read more...

More about Apple, Business, and Bob Mansfield

item.title: Amazon's Hiring Spree and Other News You Need to Know
item.dc:creator: Stan Schroeder
item.description:
Welcome to this morning's edition of "First To Know," a series in which we keep you in the know on what's happening in the digital world.

Today, we're looking at three particularly interesting storiesYahoo continues to scoop up tech talent around world over. According to AllThingsD, the company is planning to acquire ecommerce app platform LexityAmazon is also adding talent; it's hiring for more than 5,000 full-time jobs throughout its fulfillment network. And an image of what appears to be plastic retail packaging could confirm rumors of the iPhone 5C, the iPhone's cheaper, plastic cousin.

Check out the video above for more on these stories. Read more...

More about Yahoo, Amazon, Iphone, Features, and First To Know Series

item.title: With 2 Million Users, Fashion App Pose Introduces Advertising
item.dc:creator: Lauren Indvik
item.description:
It's been two and a half years since Pose first launched on the iPhone, going on to expand to new platforms, including the web, iPad and Android. Having recently passed the 2 million registered users mark, Pose is now getting serious about turning its app into a real business.

On Monday, Pose launched an ad campaign with Juicy Couture Fragrances to promote its Viva La Juicy Noir fragrance (see image below). The ads aren't typical banner display units, fixed to the top or bottom of the app: Instead, they're modified takes on the app's standard "pose" and appear in-stream with poses uploaded by regular users. Users can "love" and "save" the ads just as they can with other poses. Read more...

More about Advertising, Pose, Business, and Startups

item.title: 14 Weirdest Craigslist Job Postings on the Internet
item.dc:creator: Quenton Narcisse
item.description:
No activity is more stressful than job-hunting. Whether your parents are on your back about being unemployed or desperate for some green in your pocket, it can be quite an overwhelming process.

Craigslist is such an avenue for anyone hoping to test the job market. However, for a website that thrives on its unmoderated, anything-goes antics, it can make for quite an interesting browsing session.

SEE ALSO: The 10 Most Viral YouTube Videos of 2012

Most ads are pretty straightforward, but mixed in between is a plethora of weird requests. We've rounded up the strangest (and totally SFW) Craigslist classified. Browse the gallery above, then consider prepping your resume. Best of luck! Read more...

More about Craigslist, Lists, Job, Watercooler, and Weirdest

item.title: Kmart's Back, Without the Off-Color Puns
item.dc:creator: Todd Wasserman
item.description:
Kmart, which became an unlikely purveyor of viral video ads earlier this year with "Ship My Pants" and "Big Gas Savings," has set the off-color puns aside for a back-to-school effort featuring 10- to 13-year-old rappers.

The ad, from Draftfcb, features Da Rich Kidzz, a group of six tweens from Minnepolis. The tune, "My Limo," includes lyrics like "My school bus is my limo … I rule back to school with my cap on and my brim low." In the video, all the members of the group sport Kmart clothes

See also: 20 Funniest YouTube Videos According to Reddit

The retailer's earlier two videos have received more than 35 million views on YouTube in total. This latest video has gotten a respectable 160,000 views since it went live last Thursday. Read more...

More about Advertising, Marketing, Kmart, and Business

item.title: 10 Best Back-to-School Laptops
item.dc:creator: Taylor Casti
item.description:
A laptop is undoubtedly at the top of most student’s back-to-school wish list. From writing papers and posting online discussions to sharing party photos and playing games, your laptop should be tailored to your lifestyle.

No model is one-size-fits-all, and students come with a particular set of needs when it comes to choosing a laptop. However, keeping a few factors in mind will help to ensure you don't end up with buyer’s remorse by the time finals week rolls around

See also: Tiny Tech: 10 Space-Saving Gadgets for Dorm Rooms

Check out these tips and then see our top picks for students in the above gallery. Read more...

More about Gallery, Features, Tech, College, and Back To School

item.title: 36 High-Quality Flat Design Resources
item.dc:creator: Grace Smith
item.description:
In contrast to skeuomorphic design, flat design focuses on simple shapes, colors and typography to emphasize clarity and usability. It was a term coined by Allan Grinshtein of LayerVault in his post "The Flat Design Era," published last year. The release of iOS 7 proved flat design is no longer a passing fad, but rather a step forward.

The flatness of style means simplifying interface elements, removing extraneous elements and decoration — such as bevels, gradients and textures — to create a crisp, clean design that focuses on hierarchy

SEE ALSO: The 25 Best Free iPad Apps

To help you get started with flat design, we have compiled 36 beautifully designed premium and free UI PSD kits, each featuring a variety of interface components and elements for use in your projects Read more...

More about Web Design, Features, Design, User Interface, and Ui

item.title: What's Next for NASA: Planned Missions Through 2030
item.dc:creator: Nina Frazier
item.description:
NASA has accomplished some awe-inspiring things since it was formed on July 28, 1958. From putting man on the moon to the Mars Rover's recent explorations of the Red Planet, NASA's missions have led to great advancements in science and technology

In honor of NASA's 55th Anniversary we put together this infographic that shows NASA's planned expeditions through 2030

Do you think man will travel to Mars by 2030? Let us know in the comments.

Additional reporting by Amanda Wills. Illustration by Bob Al-Greene. Read more...

More about Space, Nasa, Mars, Infographics, and Us World

item.title: The Teacher's Guide to Social Media
item.dc:creator: Eric Larson
item.description:
Education is a two-way street — oftentimes, those who teach could stand to learn a few things as well.

Social media, for one, is largely dominated by Generation Y. We invented it, we grew up with it and we know it like the back of our keyboard-ready hands

See also: 12 Things Students Should Never Do on Social Media

In some schools, tablets and social networks are becoming primary classroom tools. Even digitally-versed teachers need to evolve with the language of their increasingly connected students

Don't sweat it. Below, we've thrown together some basic guidelines teachers should follow when embracing technology in the classroom Read more...

More about Social Media, Features, Education, Back To School, and Family Parenting

item.title: Toshiba Packs the Value Into Its New Satellite Laptops
item.dc:creator: Pete Pachal
item.description:
Big hard drives, generous amounts of RAM and touchscreens typically carry a premium price tag in laptops, but Toshiba is altering that picture with its new Satellite laptops.

The Satellite E55D packs a lot of tech into a fairly cheap package. For $579, you can buy a 15.6-inch laptop with a 750GB hard disk, 8GB of RAM and fifth-generation Wi-Fi (802.11ac). If you're willing to pay $699, you can get a model equipped for touch as well as a hard-disk expansion to 1TB.

SEE ALSO: How to Install Windows 8 Without Ditching Windows 7

The tradeoff: the E55 carries a quad-core AMD A6 ("Kabini") processor rather than an Intel Core chip. Screen resolution is also fairly average at 1,366 x 768. But the machine benefits from Toshiba's overall laptop design sensibilities, boasting an aluminum lid and palmrest, an LED backlit keyboard and DTS-enhanced audio. Read more...

More about Windows 8, Laptops, Toshiba, Ultrabooks, and Tech

item.title: 10 Best Headphones for Your Workout
item.dc:creator: Amy Burke
item.description:
When exercising, a dislodged headphone interrupts your fitness time and takes you out of "the zone" you worked so hard to reach in the first place.

According to marketing information firm NPD Group, when it comes to headphones, consumers are most interested in sound quality, noise cancellation and water/sweat resistance. But people are increasingly looking to in-line controls and microphones, too.

SEE ALSO: 10 Best iPhone Armbands

Considering we all have different ear sizes, the one-size-fits-all technique isn't always the best way find the perfect workout buddy. Instead, consider investing in a solid pair over a cheap option that tangles up and poops out fast. Whether it is in-ear, out-ear, on-ear, over-ear or wireless you are looking for, we curated our tops picks in the market now. Read more...

More about Gadgets, Fitness, Features, Headphones, and Tech
item.content:encoded:
When exercising, a dislodged headphone interrupts your fitness time and takes you out of "the zone" you worked so hard to reach in the first place.

According to marketing information firm NPD Group, when it comes to headphones, consumers are most interested in sound quality, noise cancellation and water/sweat resistance. But people are increasingly looking to in-line controls and microphones, too.

SEE ALSO: 10 Best iPhone Armbands

Considering we all have different ear sizes, the one-size-fits-all technique isn't always the best way find the perfect workout buddy. Instead, consider investing in a solid pair over a cheap option that tangles up and poops out fast. item.title: 4,000 Ships Fight in Largest-Ever Video Game Battle
item.dc:creator: Stan Schroeder
item.description:
More than 4,000 ships fought in a huge battle in EVE Online, a massive multiplayer space game.

Since EVE Online users play in a persistant universe, as opposed to the game being divided into multiple worlds, like in World of Warcraft, it routinely breaks records for most populous in-game events.

According to Erlendur S. Þorsteinsson, the Sofware Director at Iceland-based CCP (the company that develops EVE Online), 4070 ships participated in this battle, making it the largest-ever in EVE online and squashing the previous record by some 400 ships

The fleet fight in 6VDT-H tonight is the largest ever in EVE, topping at 4070 pilots (so far). Previous was P-2TTL at 3615#tweetfleet

— Erlendur (@erlendur) July 28, 2013 Read more...

More about Entertainment, Gaming, Eve Online, and Space Battle

item.title: Yawn-Activated Machine Gives You Free Douwe Egberts Coffee
item.dc:creator: Sean Fitz-Gerald
item.description:
Somewhere out there is a world where you don't have to wait in line for coffee — where you don't have to get stampeded by caffeine addicts, where all you have to do is yawn, and magically, your warm cup of joe is there waiting for you. You're safe and you're satisfied. Dreaming?

Well, Dutch coffee company Douwe Egberts, as part of a new campaign, is making those dreams come true. The company souped up a coffee vending machine with facial recognition technology and created a mechanical barista that dishes you what is essentially a free cup. The machine was placed in front of weary red-eye travelers at airports (see above and below). Read more...

More about Video, Coffee, Vending Machine, Newsy, and Videos

item.title: Augmented Reality Greeting Cards Deliver Personalized Messages
item.dc:creator: Luisa Rollenhagen
item.description:
Although it's always nice to receive a thoughtful greeting card, they're not exactly the most innovative medium.

A new Kickstarter from Artiphany is attempting to change this by developing Augmented Reality greeting cards which feature customizable 3D video messages.

See also: 7 Free Tools for Creating Your Own Fonts

The project, called Gizmo greeting cards, features Gizmo the robot, who materializes to wish the receiver a happy birthday, a happy holiday or a happy Valentine's Day.

The cards come with a selection of stickers, and when the appropriate code is scanned, Gizmo appears and delivers the corresponding message. Read more...

More about Greeting Cards, Augmented Reality, Kickstarter, Tech, and Apps Software

item.title: Design Reimagines Google Glass as Fashionable Eyewear
item.dc:creator: Luisa Rollenhagen
item.description:
While Google Glass is a technological marvel, it isn't exactly the most stylish of gadgets. Its awkward frame and chunky camera make the wearer look like they belong in a science-fiction film.

So, in an effort to make Glass more stylish, software-development firm Sourcebits reimagined the device's look

See also: Top 28 Google Street View Sightings

The revamped glasses, shown in the above video, have a retro appearance, complete with thick, black frames.

A team of designers, illustrators and 3D-modelers envisioned frames that embrace all of Glass' technology, while redistributing the hardware more evenly. Read more...

More about Tech, Dev Design, Gadgets, Newsy, and Google Glass

item.title: Watch Photosynthesis Light Up Earth From Space
item.dc:creator: Vignesh Ramachandran
item.description:
We can't see it with the naked human eye, so NASA scientists have figured out how to use satellites to show plants undergoing photosynthesis.

Photosynthesis is a process plants go through to convert sunlight into energy. As explained in the video above, NASA researchers are using satellites in orbit to map photosynthesis across Earth, monitoring plants' health. NASA says healthy plants undergoing active photosynthesis show lots of fluorescence, while stressed plants or those shutting down have low or no fluorescence

See also: 10 Brilliant Photos of the Moon and Jupiter

These maps can uncover trends in photosynthesis over time. NASA says these records could help farmers detect stressed crops early and help ecologists "better understand global vegetation and carbon cycle processes." Read more...

More about Space, Nasa, Earth, Satellite, and Us World

item.title: Get Unlimited Ringtone Downloads With This App
item.dc:creator: Anita Li
item.description:
Tired of the same old stock ringtones? One app called Klingelring claims to give users access to millions of ringtones for the iPhone, iPad or iPod.

According to the app's iTunes page, the process is simple: Just search for a song, then download. There's also a preview function, so users can test out ringtones before committing

"Do without expensive subscriptions and complicated conversions that cost time and much money," Klingelring says on its iTunes page

The free app can also convert an iDevice's entire music library into ringtones. It finds a song's refrain, and automatically "cuts it" as a ringtone Read more...

More about Apps, Ringtone, Ringtones, Music, and Tech

item.title: 'Jobs' Movie Unveils Multimedia-Heavy Website
item.dc:creator: Sean Fitz-Gerald
item.description:
The team behind the forthcoming Steve Jobs biopic starring Ashton Kutcher is taking promotional tactics to the next level. Along with an already intense social-media hype strategy, the official website for Jobs is now up and running.

The official website for #JobsMovie just launched! Be the first to check it out: http://t.co/g7GqJPWXp9 pic.twitter.com/MaEhbKetof

— JOBS (@JobsTheFilm) July 27, 2013

The site features a variety of multimedia components, including Instagram trailers, Tumblr GIFs, photos and video clips, as well as links to the movie's social-media profiles (which are already heavily advertising Jobs). Read more...

More about Entertainment, Apple, Tumblr, Film, and Steve Jobs

item.title: Teenage Sloths are the New Millennials
item.dc:creator: Laura Vitto
item.description:
Teen sloths these days! They're lazy, narcissistic, constantly on their smartphones and they all still live with their parents.

SEE ALSO: More Sunday Comics

In this Sunday comic, Maria Scrivan imagines sloths embodying the deadly sin they were named for

Comic written and illustrated by Maria Scrivan. Published with permission; all rights reserved.

BONUS: 10 Cute Animals and the Inanimate Objects They Love Read more...

item.title: Should You Take a Break From Social Media on Your Vacation?
item.dc:creator: Amy-Mae Elliott
item.description:
Before social media, smartphones and tablets, going on vacation meant taking a hiatus from just about everything — no breaking news, no email and no updates from friends. If you really wanted to let loved ones know how your holiday was going, you'd send a postcard via snail mail, which probably didn't even arrive until after you returned

These days, we can be as connected to current affairs — and the affairs of our friends and family — on vacation as we are at home. In return, we update our statuses with vacation-related news and photos as we see fit

See also: Should You Take a Vacation From Checking Your Email? Read more...

More about Facebook, Social Media, Features, Vacation, and Lifestyle

item.title: Photographer Dissects Golf Balls to Reveal Gorgeous Guts
item.dc:creator: Allison Reiber
item.description:
You don't need to be following the PGA Tour to appreciate this golf story

One day, curiosity struck photographer James Friedman and he decided to cut a golf ball from his collection in half

The cross-sections revealed something unexpected — a beautiful display of colors and layers. He writes, "To my surprise, what I found inside inspired me to consider that I could discover, in the unlikeliest of places, elegant formal qualities and surprising metaphorical possibilities."

See also: Awe-Inspiring LEGO Art Display Opens in Times Square

"Incidentally," Friedman writes, "I do not play golf."

Click through the gallery above to see the beautiful Interior Design series. Read more...

More about Gallery, List, Pics, Watercooler, and Lists
